group_1.textLeft: It seems you've finished your phone call.

group_1.textRight: I have, yes.

group_1.textLeft: What was intended as a check-in turned out@to be a pretty alarming conversation.
You still want to see Kamihama destroyed?

group_1.textRight: I don't consider it when I see my parents or the@even older generations go about their prattle.

group_1.textLeft: So it's just the younger generation, then?

group_1.textRight: Our generation holds great anxiety over@the city's state of being.
And if Kamihama's future leaders are raised in@such a way that they perpetuate these attitudes,
what is that, if not despair?

group_1.textLeft: Well, I can see the logic in that.

group_1.textRight: A statement like that is meaningless coming@from you,
given you've been warped from the start.
Regarding what you mentioned about@Kamihama's history...
I received a reply about Tsuyu and Chizuru.
*Giggle*
My assumption that the subject had been one@of her past interests turned out to be correct.

group_1.textLeft: It's so thrilling to see all the bits and pieces@starting to come together.

group_1.textRight: Even if it turns out for the worst?

group_1.textLeft: Whether positive or negative, our academic@inquisitiveness will be enriched either way!
Even the most disastrous results are a delight.

group_1.textRight: May I see what it says?

group_1.narration: The names of the two girls, Tsuyu Mizuna and Chizuru,@do indeed appear in literature found in Kamihama.@During the Warring States period,@they were dubbed "Battle-Shamanesses,"@which suggests they made immense achievements@in the attack on the castle led by the Mizuna clan.
When it comes to the stories of the actual women in play,@however, there are very few that remain.@The only clues we have to their identities@are the documents and diaries in the Mizuna Museum.
Here's what we've gathered from that:
1: As previously mentioned,@they were known as "Battle-Shamanesses,"@the ones who liberated Mizuna from their lord's tyranny.
2: There was an object that washed ashore@that prompted both sides to join hands.
3: Although they worked hand-in-hand,@Tsuyu Mizuna and Chizuru parted ways@after freeing the people from oppression.

group_1.textLeft: The Tokime's Diviners, the Battle-Shamanesses@of Kamihama...
Perhaps there really were Magical Girls scattered@throughout history, known under different titles.

group_1.textRight: This information about Tsuyu and Chizuru@leaves me unfulfilled, however.
The story I've known is one of great deeds done@hand-in-hand,
but now that we've opened the lid on it, it turns@out they went their separate ways afterwards...

group_1.textLeft: It is an existence that comes together once@per year, then moves apart.

group_1.textRight: ...[wait:1.0][chara:101601:cheek_0][chara:101601:voiceFull_fullvoice/section_102803/vo_full_102803-10-40][chara:101601:lipSynch_1]To approach and to depart...
I suppose they come to mind because of who@I've just spoken with,
but I can only think of Tsukuyo and Tsukasa...
